psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 119,53]]Indignation seizes me because of the wicked
who forsake your law.
[[Ps 119,61]]Though the snares of the wicked are twined about me,
your law I have not forgotten.

[[Ps 119,134]]Redeem me from the oppression of men,
that I may keep your precepts.
[[Ps 119,150]]I am attacked by malicious persecutors
who are far from your law.

[[Ps 119,155]]Far from sinners is salvation,
because they seek not your statutes.
[[Ps 119,158]]I beheld the apostates with loathing,
because they kept not to your promise.

first_reading.text:
[[1_M 1,10]][From the descendants of Alexanderâ€™s officers] there sprang a sinful offshoot, Antiochus Epiphanes, son of King Antiochus, once a hostage at Rome. He became king in the year one hundred and thirty seven of the kingdom of the Greeks.
[[1_M 1,11]]In those days there appeared in Israel men who were breakers of the law, and they seduced many people, saying: "Let us go and make an alliance with the Gentiles all around us; since we separated from them, many evils have come upon us."
[[1_M 1,12]]The proposal was agreeable;
[[1_M 1,13]]some from among the people promptly went to the king, and he authorized them to introduce the way of living of the Gentiles.
[[1_M 1,14]]Thereupon they built a gymnasium in Jerusalem according to the Gentile custom.
[[1_M 1,15]]They covered over the mark of their circumcision and abandoned the holy covenant; they allied themselves with the Gentiles and sold themselves to wrongdoing.
[[1_M 1,41]]Then the king wrote to his whole kingdom that all should be one people,
[[1_M 1,42]]each abandoning his particular customs. All the Gentiles conformed to the command of the king,
[[1_M 1,43]]and many Israelites were in favor of his religion; they sacrificed to idols and profaned the sabbath.
[[1_M 1,54]]On the fifteenth day of the month Chislev, in the year one hundred and forty-five, the king erected the horrible abomination upon the altar of holocausts, and in the surrounding cities of Judah they built pagan altars.
[[1_M 1,55]]They also burnt incense at the doors of houses and in the streets.
[[1_M 1,56]]Any scrolls of the law which they found they tore up and burnt.
[[1_M 1,57]]Whoever was found with a scroll of the covenant, and whoever observed the law, was condemned to death by royal decree.
[[1_M 1,62]]But many in Israel were determined and resolved in their hearts not to eat anything unclean;
[[1_M 1,63]]they preferred to die rather than to be defiled with unclean food or to profane the holy covenant; and they did die. Terrible affliction was upon Israel.
[[1_M 1,64]]
first_reading.title: 2nd book of Maccabees

gospel.text:
[[Lc 18,35]]As Jesus approached Jericho a blind man was sitting by the roadside begging,
[[Lc 18,36]]and hearing a crowd going by, he inquired what was happening.
[[Lc 18,37]]They told him, "Jesus of Nazareth is passing by."
[[Lc 18,38]]He shouted, "Jesus, Son of David, have pity on me!"
[[Lc 18,39]]The people walking in front rebuked him, telling him to be silent, but he kept calling out all the more, "Son of David, have pity on me!"
[[Lc 18,40]]Then Jesus stopped and ordered that he be brought to him; and when he came near, Jesus asked him,
[[Lc 18,41]]What do you want me to do for you? He replied, "Lord, please let me see."
[[Lc 18,42]]Jesus told him, "Have sight; your faith has saved you."
[[Lc 18,43]]He immediately received his sight and followed him, giving glory to God. When they saw this, all the people gave praise to God.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
